title: Life on the Mississippi - The passage suggests

content.question: The passage primarily suggests that

choices.label: although the speaker loves the river, he must leave it in order to challenge himself
as the speaker becomes obsessed with the river, he increasingly fears and mistrusts it
as the speaker becomes more familiar with the river, his attitude toward it becomes more practical
because the speaker is eager to improve his navigational skills, he is willing to abandon other pleasures

content.answer: as the speaker becomes more familiar with the river, his attitude toward it becomes more practical

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Identify and explain the function of point of view in a narrative.
